answers.answer: Hello,Itchy skin without any rash can be due to dermatitis, hives, internal diseases like liver and kidney disorders,diabetes, iron deficiency anemia, irritation and allergic reactions to chemicals,wool,soaps,cosmetics and certain foods . Since you have undergone gall baldder surgery, so it can be due to dermatitis or hives. Even the liver function tests need to be evaluated. Till that time, take a comfortably cool bath and wear smooth-textured cotton clothing and take some oral antihistaminic like Benadryl.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: For years I have had bouts of itching & stinging all over, I had a bout of Lichen Planus right before my gall bladder surgery & a few months after the surgery this itching & stinging started there is no rash with this..I had another bout of Lichen Planus when I quit smoking but the itching and stinging is chronic it will go away for awhile then come back...I have let it go but I sometimes wonder if its something from the gall bladder surgery & this is something I have put up with for YEARS....Thanks...Lee
